item.title: 苹果公司库克会见中国商务部长，公布投资计划
item.description: 苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）在继续对中国进行高调访问时表示，苹果公司计划进一步投资中国的研究。【原文：Apple Inc. plans to invest further in research in China, Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said as he continues his high-profile visit to the country.】

item.title: 滴滴全球计划香港上市前收入大增
item.description: 滴滴出行第四季度营收同比增长55%，在计划于今年在香港上市之前，这家中国叫车服务领军企业的业绩持续逐步复苏。【原文：Didi Global Inc.’s fourth-quarter revenue rose 55% from a year earlier, sustaining the Chinese ride-hailing leader’s gradual recovery ahead of a planned listing in Hong Kong this year.】

item.title: 墨西哥道达尔游戏公司推出新的交换计划以消除再融资疑虑
item.description: 里卡多-萨利纳斯-普利戈（Ricardo Salinas Pliego）的互联网和有线电视供应商 Total Play Telecomunicaciones SA 提出了一项交换要约，旨在恢复这位亿万富翁在全球投资者心目中的信誉。【原文：Ricardo Salinas Pliego’s internet and cable provider Total Play Telecomunicaciones SA proposed a swap offer aimed at restoring the billionaire’s credibility with global investors following a yearlong roller-coaster ride through distressed territory.】

item.title: Ecopetrol 投资者批准被认为不称职的新董事
item.description: 尽管一份内部报告警告说新董事会成员缺乏监管公司所需的经验，但 Ecopetrol SA 股东还是批准了新的董事会成员。【原文：Ecopetrol SA shareholders approved new board members despite an internal report that warned they lack the experience needed to oversee the company.】

item.title: 宏观风险温和，高盛上调美元兑日元预测
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. raised its forecasts for the dollar versus the yen, expecting a benign macro setup to weigh on the Japanese currency in coming months.】

item.title: 中国城市在人潮褪去之前抓住了麻辣美食的狂潮
item.description: 大量游客突然涌入这座中国城市，令人应接不暇。政府部门开放了通常受到限制的停车场，以容纳激增的游客。铁路运营商延长了列车服务。官员们紧急召开会议，讨论下一步该怎么做。【原文：The influx of tourists to the Chinese city was sudden and overwhelming. Government offices opened their normally restricted parking lots to accommodate the surge. Railway operators extended train services. Officials held a snap meeting to discuss what to do next.】

item.title: 日本股市繁荣获得的支持不仅限于出口商
item.description: 即使是 2007 年以来的首次加息，也未能减缓日本股市破纪录的飙升势头。【原文：Not even an interest-rate hike for the first time since 2007 has slowed the record-breaking surge in Japanese shares.】

item.title: 芝加哥市长寻求发行 12.5 亿美元住房和发展债券
item.description: 芝加哥市长布兰登-约翰逊（Brandon Johnson）提议出售高达 12.5 亿美元的住房和经济发展债券，在五年内平均分配，以刺激面临人口下降和近年来失去一些知名雇主的城市的经济增长。【原文：Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson is proposing the sale of up to $1.25 billion in housing and economic development bonds, split evenly over five years, to spur growth in the city facing population decline and the loss in recent years of some high-profile employers.】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克预计今年仅降息一次
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）表示，他现在预计今年只会降息一次，并补充说降息时间可能会比他之前预计的晚一些。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic says he now projects just one interest-rate cut this year, adding that reduction will likely happen later in the year than he previously expected.】

item.title: 西南天然气基础设施服务公司 Centuri 申请 IPO
item.description: 在与亿万富翁激进投资者卡尔-伊坎（Carl Icahn）发生争执后，电力公司西南天然气控股公司（Southwest Gas Holdings Inc.【原文：Power company Southwest Gas Holdings Inc. is moving forward with the carve-out of its infrastructure services business about two years after announcing the split, following a spat with billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn.】

item.title: 对冲基金在日本央行鸽派加息后加大日元看跌押注
item.description: 对冲基金在日本央行 3 月会议前的一周加大了看跌日元的赌注，当时日本央行官员结束了世界上最后一个负利率制度，但承诺采取宽松立场，这将日元拖至 2024 年的低点。【原文：Hedge funds ramped up bearish yen wagers in the week stretching through the Bank of Japan’s March meeting, when officials ended the world’s last negative rate-regime but pledged an accommodative stance that dragged the Japanese currency to 2024 lows.】

item.title: 宽容的鲍威尔让华尔街掀起购买狂潮
item.description: 华尔街对美联储政策以及鲍威尔应如何处理飙升的资产价格的争论再次激化。然而，对于交易员来说，当他们在各种市场上沉淀资金时，现在该做什么并没有争论。【原文：Arguments on Wall Street rage anew over Federal Reserve policy — and how Jerome Powell should handle soaring asset prices. Yet for traders there’s no debate about what to do right now as they sink money across markets of all stripes.】

item.title: 可可加工商布隆默关闭芝加哥巧克力工厂
item.description: 可可加工商 Blommer 巧克力公司将关闭其芝加哥巧克力工厂，因为老化的设施已不再可靠。【原文：Cocoa processor Blommer Chocolate Co. will close its Chicago chocolate factory as the aging facility is no longer reliable.】

item.title: PNC 首席执行官称房地产不太可能成为银行的系统性问题
item.description: PNC Financial Services Group Inc.首席执行官威廉-德姆查克（William Demchak）表示，商业房地产债务问题可能会给一些小型贷款机构带来麻烦，但不太可能成为美国银行业的大问题。【原文：Troubled commercial real estate debt could lead to problems for some small lenders, but isn’t likely to be an issue for the broader US banking industry, said William Demchak, chief executive officer of PNC Financial Services Group Inc.】

item.title: 赞比亚寻求债务重组 "余地 "以发展经济
item.description: 赞比亚一位高级政府官员表示，赞比亚正在努力完成拖延已久的债务重组，这将为其吸引投资和启动经济增长提供 "余地"。【原文：Zambia is working to finalize a long-delayed debt restructuring that would give it “headroom” to attract investment and jump-start economic growth, a senior government official said.】

item.title: 埃克森石油公司坚信其圭亚那合同的写作意图将获胜
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司坚信，在与雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）具有里程碑意义的仲裁案中，该公司对十年前签署的一份圭亚那石油合同中的意图的解释将占上风。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. is convinced its interpretation of intent in a Guyanese oil contract signed a decade ago will prevail in a landmark arbitration case against Chevron Corp.】

item.title: 欧洲央行森特诺称政策将对通胀回落做出反应
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马里奥-森特诺（Mario Centeno）表示，随着通胀率向2%的目标回落，欧洲中央银行必须—也将—采取行动。【原文：The European Central Bank must — and will — act as inflation retreats toward its 2% target, according to Governing Council member Mario Centeno.】

item.title: 州立农场以野火风险为由削减 7.2 万份加州保单
item.description: 州立农场通用保险公司将从 7 月开始在加州削减约 7.2 万份保单，这是加州最大的保险公司为应对野火和其他自然灾害带来的日益增长的风险而采取的最新举措。【原文：State Farm General Insurance Co. will cut about 72,000 policies in California beginning in July, the latest move by the state’s biggest insurer to cope with growing risks from wildfires and other natural disasters.】

item.title: Centerview 为 Superior Industries 的债务聘请私人信贷机构
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Centerview Partners 已与私人信用贷款机构就车轮供应商 Superior Industries International Inc.【原文：Centerview Partners has held conversations with private credit lenders to refinance the outstanding debt of wheel supplier Superior Industries International Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 华平聘请高盛老将贝克尔负责资本解决方案
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，华平投资集团聘请高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Warburg Pincus hired Goldman Sachs Group Inc. veteran Lee Becker as a managing director within its capital solutions group, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 奇货通讯：我们现在都是供应方
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 私人信贷与银行争夺贷款支持阿普勒纳收购案
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，银行和直接贷款机构正在争相安排约 18 亿欧元（19.5 亿美元）的一揽子债务，以支持对 Apleona Group GmbH 的潜在收购。【原文：Banks and direct lenders are vying to arrange a debt package for about €1.8 billion ($1.95 billion) to back the potential buyout of Apleona Group GmbH, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚加快降息步伐，做出两难决定
item.description: 哥伦比亚将降息步伐加快了一倍，以重振疲软的经济，但两位央行行长呼吁加快宽松步伐。【原文：Colombia doubled the pace of interest rate cuts to revive the weak economy, but two central bankers called for even faster easing.】

item.title: Cerberus 支持的 ECI 就 11 亿美元私人贷款举行会谈
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Cerberus 支持的电器元件国际公司（Electrical Components International）已与私人信贷公司就新贷款进行了讨论，该贷款将为该公司的广泛银团债务再融资。【原文：Cerberus-backed Electrical Components International has held discussions with private credit firms for a new loan that would refinance the company’s broadly syndicated debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国银行购买巴西陷入困境的化肥生产商 Unigel 的债券
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国银行（Bank of America Corp）是收购陷入困境的巴西化肥生产商 Unigel Participacoes SA 当地债券的公司之一。【原文：Bank of America Corp. is among firms scooping up local bonds from struggling Brazilian fertilizer maker Unigel Participacoes SA, according to people familiar to the matter.】

item.title: 米莱副总统与妹妹争夺在阿根廷的影响力
item.description: 阿根廷副总统维多利亚-比利亚鲁埃尔（Victoria Villarruel）说，哈维尔-米莱伊是夹在两个强势人物中间的 "可怜的小火腿"，这两个强势人物都试图塑造阿根廷领导人政府的方向，这是政府内部摩擦的最明显迹象。【原文：Javier Milei is a “poor little ham” sandwiched between two powerful figures seeking to shape the direction of the Argentine leader’s government, Vice President Victoria Villarruel said in the clearest sign yet of friction within the administration.】

item.title: 期权显示比特币交易者正为更深的暴跌做准备
item.description: 期权交易表明，随着持有比特币的美国交易所交易基金的需求开始减弱，交易者正准备迎接比特币的长期下跌。【原文：Options suggest that traders are bracing for an extended decline in Bitcoin with demand for US exchange-traded funds holding the cryptocurrency beginning to wane.】

item.title: 佩尔茨质疑迪士尼为《惊奇世界》和《黑豹》选角
item.description: 纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）质疑华特-迪士尼公司（Walt Disney Co.【原文：Nelson Peltz has questioned Walt Disney Co.’s decision to pursue female- and Black-led casting on certain Marvel movies, as he enters the final stretch of his fight for a board seat at the entertainment giant.】

item.title: Ares 和 KKR 是寻求利用霸菱倒闭事件的贷款人之一
item.description: Ares Management Corp.、KKR & Co.和 Intermediate Capital Group Plc 等私人信贷公司正寻求利用霸菱的麻烦，因为 20 多名员工的突然离职迫使霸菱暂停了一些投资。【原文：Private credit firms including Ares Management Corp., KKR & Co. and Intermediate Capital Group Plc are looking to capitalize on troubles at Barings after the sudden exit of over 20 employees forced it to pause some investments.】

item.title: 美联储权衡资产流出放缓，在储备金问题上慎之又慎
item.description: 随着美联储考虑尽快放缓资产负债表的缩减速度，华尔街也在密切关注银行储备金的适当水平，以保证流动性并避免过去金融市场的崩溃。【原文：As the Federal Reserve contemplates slowing the runoff of its balance sheet fairly soon, Wall Street is honing in on what level of bank reserves is appropriate to guarantee liquidity and avert past blowups in financial markets.】
